name: 1. T1595: Active Scanning
description: This query looks for a single source IP address connecting to more than 100 different ports on your Ubuntu machine within a 10-minute time window, which could indicate a port scan.
query: event.dataset : "auditd_manager.auditd" and event.action : "executed" and process.name : ("nmap" or "nc" or  "tcpdump" or "masscan" or "tshark")

name: 10. T1119: Automated Collection
description: This query looks for the use of the find command to search for files with common sensitive extensions.
query:
event.action : "executed" and process.name : "find" and
(
    process.command_line : "*.doc*" or
    process.command_line : "*.xls*" or
    process.command_line : "*.pdf*" or
    process.command_line : "*.txt*" or
    process.command_line : "*.bak*" or
    process.command_line : "*.kdbx*"
)

name: 11. T1071: Application Layer Protocol (C2)
description: This query looks for network connections from a process running out of a suspicious location, such as /tmp.
query:
event.category : "network" and network.direction : "outbound" and
(
    process.executable : "/tmp/*" or
    process.executable : "/var/tmp/*" or
    process.executable : "/dev/shm/*"
)

name: 12. T1048: Exfiltration Over Alternative Protocol
description: This query looks for the use of scp to copy files to a remote destination.
query:
event.action : "executed" and
(process.name : "scp" or process.name : "rsync") and
process.command_line : "*@*"

name: 2. T1566: Phishing
description: This rule looks for a script interpreter being launched by an email client or a document application, which could indicate a user opening a malicious attachment.
query:
event.action : "executed" and
(
    process.parent.name : "thunderbird" or
    process.parent.name : "outlook.exe" or
    process.parent.name : "soffice.bin" or
    process.parent.name : "winword.exe" or
    process.parent.name : "excel.exe" or
    process.parent.name : "powerpnt.exe" or
    process.parent.name : "evince" or
    process.parent.name : "okular" or
    process.parent.name : "acrord32.exe" or
    process.parent.name : "firefox" or
    process.parent.name : "chrome" or
    process.parent.name : "msedge.exe"
) and
(
    process.name : "bash" or
    process.name : "sh" or
    process.name : "zsh" or
    process.name : "cmd.exe" or
    process.name : "python" or
    process.name : "perl" or
    process.name : "powershell.exe" or
    process.name : "pwsh.exe" or
    process.name : "wscript.exe" or
    process.name : "cscript.exe" or
    process.name : "mshta.exe"
)

name: 3. T1059: Command and Scripting Interpreter
description: This query looks for the use of bash with suspicious command-line arguments that are often used to execute encoded or obfuscated commands.
query:
event.action : "executed" and
(process.parent.name : "thunderbird" or process.parent.name : "soffice.bin" or process.parent.name : "evince") and
(process.name : "bash" or process.name : "sh" or process.name : "python" or process.name : "perl")

name: 4. T1547: Boot or Logon Autostart Execution
description: This query monitors for the creation or modification of files in common persistence locations.
query:
event.category : "file" and
(event.action : "creation" or event.action : "change") and
(
    file.path : "/etc/systemd/system/*" or
    file.path : "/home/*/.config/autostart/*" or
    file.path : "/etc/cron.d/*" or
    file.path : "/etc/rc.local"
)

name: 5. T1548: Abuse Elevation Control Mechanism
description: This rule looks for a user trying to run sudo with the -l flag to list their permissions, which could be a precursor to privilege escalation.

name: 6. T1027: Obfuscated Files or Information
description: This query looks for the use of dd to hide data in an alternate data stream, a common obfuscation technique.

name: 7. T1003: OS Credential Dumping
description: This query alerts when a process other than a standard system utility attempts to read the /etc/shadow file, which contains hashed user passwords.
query:
event.category : "file" and event.action : "access" and
file.path : "/etc/shadow" and
not (
    process.name : "passwd" or
    process.name : "chage" or
    process.name : "useradd" or
    process.name : "login" or
    process.name : "su" or
    process.name : "sudo" or
    process.name : "groupadd" or
    process.name : "userdel"
)

name: 8. T1082: System Information Discovery
description: This query looks for the execution of multiple common discovery commands by the same process, which could indicate an attacker is trying to learn about the system.
query:
event.action : "executed" and
(
    process.name : "whoami" or
    process.name : "hostname" or
    process.name : "uname" or
    process.name : "ifconfig" or
    process.name : "ip" or
    process.name : "netstat" or
    process.name : "lscpu" or
    process.name : "lsblk" or
    process.name : "ps"
)

name: 9. T1021: Remote Services
description: This query looks for an interactive SSH session being established, which could indicate lateral movement.
query:
event.category : "authentication" and event.outcome : "success" and
process.name : "sshd" and
(source.ip : "10.0.0.0/8" or source.ip : "172.16.0.0/12" or source.ip : "192.168.0.0/16")
